definition: Sumer (Šumer), one of the early civilizations of the Ancient Near East
Perilla frutescens (Chinese basil or wild red basil)/place name/to revive/used as phonetic in transliteration
surname Su/abbr. for Soviet Union 蘇維埃|苏维埃 or 蘇聯|苏联/abbr. for Jiangsu province 江蘇|江苏/abbr. for Suzhou city 蘇州|苏州
beautiful/very satisfactory/good/to beautify/to be pleased with oneself
the Americas/abbr. for 美洲[Mei3 zhou1]/USA/abbr. for 美國|美国[Mei3 guo2]

sentences.english: The cuneiform script is a great invention by the Sumerians.
sentences.chinese: 楔形文字是蘇美爾人的一大發明。

sentences.english: I notice that the moon is male here just as it is in Sumer and Babylon.
sentences.chinese: 我看到月亮是男性，在這裏就像是蘇美爾和巴比倫。

sentences.english: Sumer and its great civilization lie prostrate.
sentences.chinese: 蘇美爾和它的偉大文明衰竭了。

sentences.english: We know of a very ancient Sumerian flood story.
sentences.chinese: 我們都聽說過關於蘇美爾洪水的古老傳說。

sentences.english: First came the Sumerians, who were replaced in turn by the Assyrians and the Babylonians.
sentences.chinese: 首先的是蘇美爾文明，依次地被亞述和巴比倫所取代。
